text: Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.
author: Mark Twain

text: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only one page.
author: Saint Augustine

text: Travel isn't always pretty. It isn't always comfortable. Sometimes it hurts, it even breaks your heart. But that's okay. The journey changes you; it should change you.
author: Anthony Bourdain

text: We travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape us.
author: Anonymous

text: Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: Traveling â€“ it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.
author: Ibn Battuta

text: Not all who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: I am not the same, having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

text: Once a year, go someplace you've never been before.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.
author: Anonymous

text: To my mind, the greatest reward and luxury of travel is to be able to experience everyday things as if for the first time.
author: Bill Bryson

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Travel and change of place impart new vigor to the mind.
author: Seneca

text: I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.
author: Susan Sontag

text: Take only memories, leave only footprints.
author: Chief Seattle

text: People don't take trips, trips take people.
author: John Steinbeck

text: The best education I have ever received was through travel.
author: Lisa Ling

text: Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all of one's lifetime.
author: Mark Twain

text: Stuff your eyes with wonder, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: The gladdest moment in human life, methinks, is a departure into unknown lands.
author: Sir Richard Burton

text: To travel is to discover that everyone is wrong about other countries.
author: Aldous Huxley

text: Don't tell me how educated you are, tell me how much you have traveled.
author: Mohammed

text: One's destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.
author: Henry Miller

text: The use of traveling is to regulate imagination by reality, and instead of thinking how things may be, to see them as they are.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Travel far enough, you meet yourself.
author: David Mitchell

text: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

text: Life begins at the end of your comfort zone.
author: Neale Donald Walsch

text: Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education; in the elder, a part of experience.
author: Francis Bacon

text: The more I traveled the more I realized that fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: Tourists don't know where they've been, travelers don't know where they're going.
author: Paul Theroux

text: The traveler sees what he sees, the tourist sees what he has come to see.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.
author: Martin Buber

text: Travel is about the gorgeous feeling of teetering in the unknown.
author: Anthony Bourdain

text: The joy of discovery is certainly the liveliest that the mind of man can ever feel.
author: Claude Bernard

text: To awaken quite alone in a strange town is one of the most pleasant sensations in the world.
author: Freya Stark

text: Travel opens your heart, broadens your mind, and fills your life with stories to tell.
author: Paula Bendfeldt

text: The most beautiful in the world is, of course, the world itself.
author: Wallace Stevens

text: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: It is not down in any map; true places never are.
author: Herman Melville

text: There is no moment of delight in any pilgrimage like the beginning of it.
author: Charles Dudley Warner
